oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Meet us at the ball game, as in the Gay Nineties, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A published photo from the Nashville Times (1940), about the celebration of the 50th Anniversary of Gerst Beer. The picture shows a couple dressed in Gay Nineties (1890s) clothes, riding in a horse drawn carriage. The banner draped upon a horse says “50th Anniversary Gerst Pilsner Beer.” The William Gerst Brewing Company was located at 821, 6th Avenue South. They had been brewing beer since. They were originally formed as Moerlein Gerst Brewing Company 1890-1893, then next the William Gerst Brewing Company, 1893-1954. They advertised as “The South’s Finest Beer and Ale.” Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: William Gerst Brewing Company (Nashville, Tenn.)
